page.title: 03ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES
page.content: The population of this tiny area of rural Bedfordshire feel besieged on all sides by threats to the quality of their environment. For many years they have suffered the deprivations imposed by the brick industry, followed by the perceived health hazard of infilling the clay quarries on their doorstep with industrial and domestic refuse. However, these problems pale into insignificance when the "nuclear bombshell" hit Mid-Beds: Elstow Storage Depot was the favoured site for the storage of Britain's low and medium level nuclear waste.
